resource_dependency.userSchema: Table 'users': id (UUID), email (string, unique), password_hash (string), role ('athlete' or 'organization'), created_at (timestamp)

function: User authentication system supporting login and registration for both athletes and sports organizations
static_description: A centered card with ghost white background containing two tabs: 'Login' and 'Register'. Each tab displays respective form fields referencing loginFormFields and registrationFormFields. Slate gray text inputs and buttons.

interaction_and_states.description: Switching between Login and Register tabs toggles visibility of corresponding forms.
Submitting the register form sends data to authAPI endpoint. On success redirects to dashboard; on error shows validation messages.
Submitting the login form sends credentials to authAPI endpoint. On success redirects to dashboard; on error shows invalid credentials message.

resource_dependency.profileSchema: Table 'profiles': user_id (foreign key to users.id), first_name (string), last_name (string), date_of_birth (date), location (string), sports_specialties (array of strings), experience_years (integer), bio (text), avatar_url (string)

function: Athlete profile management including personal information, sports specialties, and experience
static_description: Profile view displaying editable form fields from profileFormFields. Includes circular avatar image area with upload icon avatarUploadIcon. Form uses slate gray borders and ghost white background.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking avatar area opens file browser to select new profile picture.
Save button submits updated profile data via profileAPI. Displays success confirmation or error message.
Typing in sportsSpecialties field allows adding multiple sport tags dynamically.

resource_dependency.jobSchema: Table 'jobs': id (UUID), organization_id (foreign key to users.id), title (string), description (text), sport_type (string), location (string), deadline (date), requirements (text), status ('active' or 'closed'), created_at (timestamp)

function: Job posting functionality for sports organizations to create and manage job listings
static_description: Form layout with input fields matching jobPostFormFields. Submit button styled with slate gray background. Date picker for deadline selection. Text areas for description and requirements.

interaction_and_states.description: Submit button creates new job listing via jobPostAPI. Redirects to job listing page on success.
Edit button loads existing job data into form for modification. Save changes updates via jobPostAPI.
Delete button removes job listing after confirmation dialog via jobPostAPI.

resource_dependency.jobListSchema: Join query between jobs and users tables to get organization name

function: Job browsing interface allowing users to search and filter available positions
static_description: Top section contains search bar with searchBarIcon and filter dropdowns from filterOptions. Below shows grid of job cards using jobListingCard template. Pagination controls at bottom.

interaction_and_states.description: Typing in search bar filters results in real-time calling jobsBrowseAPI with search term.
Selecting filter options updates displayed jobs by calling jobsBrowseAPI with applied filters.
Clicking job card navigates to detailed job view page.
Pagination buttons load next/previous pages of job listings via jobsBrowseAPI.

resource_dependency.applicationSchema: Table 'applications': id (UUID), job_id (foreign key to jobs.id), athlete_id (foreign key to users.id), cover_letter (text), availability_start_date (date), status ('submitted', 'reviewed', 'accepted', 'rejected'), submitted_at (timestamp)

function: Job application system enabling athletes to apply for positions of interest
static_description: Job detail page showing full job description with prominent applyButtonLabel button. Clicking reveals modal with applicationFormFields including textarea for cover letter and date picker.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking applyButtonLabel opens application modal with pre-filled athlete info.
Submit button in modal sends application data via applicationAPI. Shows success message and closes modal on completion.
Cancel button closes modal without submitting application.

resource_dependency.conversationSchema: Tables: conversations(id), participants(conversation_id, user_id), messages(id, conversation_id, sender_id, content, timestamp)

function: Real-time messaging system facilitating communication between athletes and organizations
static_description: Chat interface with scrollable message history area using messageBubbleTemplate. Fixed input area at bottom with sendMessageForm elements. Sidebar showing conversation list with contact names.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting conversation from sidebar loads message history via messagingAPI.
Send button transmits message content via messagingAPI and appends to current chat view immediately.
Pressing Enter in message input sends message when focused.

resource_dependency.notificationSchema: Table 'notifications': id (UUID), user_id (foreign key to users.id), type (string), content (text), is_read (boolean), created_at (timestamp)

function: Notification system delivering alerts for job applications, messages, and platform updates
static_description: Top navigation bar includes notificationBellIcon badge showing unread count. Dropdown panel lists notifications using notificationItemTemplate with distinct styling for read/unread items.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking bell icon toggles visibility of notification dropdown panel populated via notificationsAPI.
Clicking individual notification marks as read via notificationsAPI and navigates to related content.
Mark all as read button updates all user notifications to read state via notificationsAPI.

resource_dependency.dashboardDataSchema: Aggregated queries joining jobs, applications, and users tables

function: Admin dashboard for sports organizations to manage posted jobs and applicant communications
static_description: Tabbed interface showing dashboardTabs. Default 'Posted Jobs' tab displays table using jobManagementTable format. Applicant column shows count linking to applicantListPanel view.

interaction_and_states.description: Switching tabs loads corresponding data views via adminDashboardAPI.
Clicking applicant count opens modal with applicantListPanel showing detailed application info.
Status toggle switches job between active/closed states via adminDashboardAPI.

function: Responsive web design with ghost white background and slate gray UI elements
static_description: Entire site uses ghost white (#F8F8FF) body background color. All interactive elements and borders use slate gray (#708090). Layout adapts across responsiveBreakpoints maintaining consistent spacing and typography hierarchy.

interaction_and_states.description: Layout adjusts according to responsiveBreakpoints with stacked mobile view, two-column tablet, and multi-panel desktop arrangement.
Header remains fixed at top during vertical scrolling on all viewport sizes.

function: Frontend application that fetches all dynamic data through backend APIs
static_description: All dynamic content sections show loadingIndicator during data requests. ErrorDisplayComponent appears when API calls fail. Data rendering waits for successful responses from apiBaseURL endpoints.

interaction_and_states.description: Component initialization triggers data fetching from configured apiBaseURL using dataFetchingLibrary.
Manual refresh button re-fetches data from same endpoints showing loading state again.

function: Backend API service connecting to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
static_description: RESTful API server configured with corsSettings accepting requests from frontend origin. Database connection established using databaseConnectionConfig values at startup.

interaction_and_states.description: Server initializes database connection pool using provided environment variables and starts listening on port 3001.
Incoming HTTP requests routed to appropriate controller functions which execute database queries using established connection.

resource_dependency.databaseERD: Users <-1:N-> Profiles, Users <-1:N-> Jobs, Jobs <-1:N-> Applications, Users <-> N:M <-> Conversations, Conversations <-1:N-> Messages, Users <-1:N-> Notifications
resource_dependency.tableDefinitions: See individual schema definitions in previous entries
resource_dependency.postgresSetupScript: CREATE DATABASE myapp; CREATE USER myappuser WITH ENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'myapppassword'; GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE myapp TO myappuser;

function: Database schema supporting users, profiles, job postings, applications, and messages
static_description: PostgreSQL database initialized with postgresSetupScript creating empty tables per defined schemas. Relationships mapped according to databaseERD showing one-to-many and many-to-many connections.

interaction_and_states.description: New records added to respective tables upon user actions (registration, job posting, applying, messaging) maintaining referential integrity.
Complex SELECT operations join related tables to serve aggregated dashboard and listing data efficiently.

resource_dependency.roleGuardMiddleware: Express middleware checking JWT claims for user.role
resource_dependency.rbacRules: athlete: read jobs, apply, message; organization: post jobs, manage apps, message; admin: all access

function: Role-based access control distinguishing between athletes and sports organizations
static_description: Each protected route in protectedRoutes requires authentication token with role claim validated by roleGuardMiddleware before processing request.

interaction_and_states.description: Requests to protected routes trigger roleGuardMiddleware which validates user role against rbacRules and either permits access or returns 403 Forbidden.
Blocked requests return standardized error response indicating insufficient permissions.

resource_dependency.cachingStrategy: Redis or in-memory cache for frequently accessed data like job listings
resource_dependency.databaseIndexingPlan: Indexes on users.email, jobs.sport_type, jobs.location, applications.job_id
resource_dependency.codeSplittingBoundaries: Separate bundles for authentication, dashboard, job browsing, messaging modules

function: Performance optimization features ensuring fast loading and smooth user experience
static_description: Application architecture implements cachingStrategy for repeated queries. Database indexing follows indexPlan. Code splitting separates large modules into codeSplittingBoundaries chunks.

interaction_and_states.description: Initial page load benefits from cached responses where applicable. Critical resources loaded first per code splitting strategy.
Subsequent identical requests served from cache reducing database load and improving response times.

resource_dependency.packageJsonScripts: {"install:all": "concurrently \"npm install\" \"cd client && npm install\" \"cd server && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"cd client && npm start\" \"cd server && npm run dev\""}
resource_dependency.projectStructure: Root directory with client/ and server/ subdirectories plus shared configs

function: Repository configuration with package.json supporting npm run install:all and npm run dev commands
static_description: Root package.json contains scripts section with install:all and dev commands executing concurrent processes in client/ and server/ directories respectively.

interaction_and_states.description: Executing 'npm run install:all' installs dependencies in root, client/, and server/ locations simultaneously.
Executing 'npm run dev' starts frontend development server on port 3000 and backend API server on port 3001 concurrently.
